{{also|Appendix:Variations of "tot"}} ==English== ===Etymology 1=== Borrowed from {{bor|en|sco|tot}}, a shortened form of {{m|sco|totum||small child; tot}}, of uncertain origin. Compare {{m|en|totter}}, {{m|en|tottle}}. Compare also {{cog|non|tottr|t=name of a dwarf}}, {{cog|sv|tutte|t=small child}}, {{cog|da|tommeltot|t=little child}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{audio|en|en-us-tot.ogg|Audio (US)}} * {{audio|en|en-uk-tot.ogg|Audio (UK)}} * {{rhymes|en|ɒt}} ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # A [[small]] [[child]]. #: ''He learned to run when he was just a '''tot'''.'' # A measure of [[spirit]]s, especially rum. #* '''1897:''' Mary H. Kingsley, ''Travels in West Africa'' #*: Then I give them a '''tot''' of rum apiece, as they sit huddled in their blankets. #* '''1916:''' Siegfried Sassoon, ''The Working Party'' #*: And '''tot''' of rum to send him warm to sleep. # {{lb|en|UK|dialect|dated}} A [[foolish]] [[fellow]]. #: {{rfquotek|en|Halliwell}} =====Translations===== {{trans-top|small child}} * Catalan: {{t+|ca|infant|m}} * Finnish: {{t|fi|napero}}, {{t+|fi|pikkulapsi}} * Galician: {{t+|gl|meniño}} * Italian: {{t+|it|bambino|m}} {{trans-mid}} * Polish: {{t+|pl|brzdąc}} * Russian: {{t+|ru|малы́ш|m}} * Spanish: {{t+|es|infante}} {{trans-bottom}} {{trans-top|measure of spirits}} * Catalan: {{t+|ca|glop|m}} * Finnish: {{t|fi|tujaus}} {{trans-mid}} * Galician: {{t|gl|fechiña|f}}, {{t|gl|parva|f}} * Italian: {{t+|it|porzione|f}}, {{t|it|tot|m}} * Russian: {{t+|ru|стопка|f}} {{trans-bottom}} ===Etymology 2=== {{short for|en|total||to sum}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{enPR|tŏt}}, {{IPA|en|/tɒt/}} ====Verb==== {{en-verb|tots|totting|totted}} # To [[sum]] or [[total]]. {{rfex|en}} # {{lb|en|UK|historical}} To mark (a [[debt]]) with the word ''tot'' (Latin for "so much"), indicating that it was good or collectible for the amount specified. #: ''a '''totted''' debt'' =====Derived terms===== * {{l|en|tot up}} ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # An [[addition]] of a long column of figures. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=ott|OTT|Ott|TTO|ott}} [[Category:en:Age]] [[Category:en:Children]] [[Category:en:People]] [[Category:en:Units of measure]] ---- ==Afrikaans== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|af|nl|tot}}, from {{inh|af|dum|tot}}, {{m|dum|tōte}}, from {{inh|af|odt|tote}}, {{m|odt|toti|t=to, until}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|af|/tɔt/}} ===Conjunction=== {{head|af|conjunction}} #
